item.title: Tweet Pinboard: January 2017 - April 2017
item.description:
Bug <-> Debug
Test <-> Detest

Is that a kind of coincidence?

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) December 30, 2016

1. ğŸ¥: ğŸ‘¯ğŸ‡ğŸ’¨ğŸš¶ãŠ™ğŸšªğŸˆğŸ›ğŸ‘’ğŸµğŸ‘¸ğŸ‘°ğŸ‘‘â™ â™¥â™£â™¦ğŸ˜´

2. ğŸ“º: ğŸºğŸ¯ğŸ²ğŸ’®ğŸ™ğŸŸ... ğŸ‘‘â¤ğŸ’”ğŸ”ğŸ”¥ğŸ’¥ğŸ”ª... ğŸ’€ğŸ˜±ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜±ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ˜¶ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ğŸ’€...

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 4, 2017

Declare variables not war,
Get bugs fixed not mindset.

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 14, 2017

A tool for work:
20 years ago, a tool is a tool.
10 years ago, a tool is a software.
5 years ago, a tool is a website.
Now a tool is an app.

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 15, 2017

Dear DEVils,
During my absence, you're authorised to use my tool for testing purpose. Any abuses are welcome.
Happy testing!
Xoxo, TESTERia pic.twitter.com/yNht8lnPDG

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 25, 2017

A good news without "but" is a perfect good news.

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 30, 2017

"In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is." ğŸ˜‰

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) January 31, 2017

"Wisely and slowly; they stumble that run fast."

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 2, 2017

Best practice only exists for someone at certain period of time. Not everyone, not always.

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 14, 2017

ğŸ¤£ true https://t.co/6S8jT0ZkX6

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 15, 2017

Oh I'm capable of suffering all small revertable changes & working on piece by piece, in order to make the world a better placeğŸ™ #AgilityGod

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 17, 2017

Testing is not about finding bugs. It's about exploring unknown area, resolving ambiguity and leaning new things. 1/2

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Like holding a troch to light up the road in darkness, you could clearly see the way to go, make a map, and mark thorns and flowers. 2/2

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Checking is not about finding bugs. It's about verifying expectation, feeling confidence of working things and killing time. 1/2

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Like holding a map in daylight, you're guided to avoid known obstacles, confident of your ability and ready for the next journey, again. 2/2

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

ğŸ¤· let me guess it's a part of How to reduce cost and assure phone call quality. ISTQB = I Swear That's Quite Boring

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) April 1, 2017

Junior XXX: I want a job even it's shitty
Senior XXX: I don't want a shitty job, no!
Expert XXX: I want to do some shitty things as my job ğŸ˜‰

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) April 11, 2017

Agility stops when HiPPO starts.

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) April 13, 2017

Certification is a decent purchase invoice. https://t.co/QgXh9a6aaF

— Kevin ğŸ‘Š (@KevCui) April 22, 2017

item.title: My Toolbox
item.description:
Software Testing

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Test case generator (pairwise)

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ Test Heuristics Cheat Sheet

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ 1-page usability test plan

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ faker-cli: generate massive amounts of fake data

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Radamsa: Radamsa is a test case generator for robustness testing, a.k.a. a fuzzer

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Ruby Pairwise: Ruby based tool for selecting a smaller number of test input combinations

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Name: all about name

ğŸŒ:point_right: Big List of Naughty Strings: list of strings which have a high probability of causing issues

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Awesome Unicode: Unicode list

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ SecLists: a collection of multiple types of lists used during security assessments

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Large images: a list of very large images above 50 Megapixel

Mobile Testing

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Test coverage optimizer: discover the optimal mix for maximizing your test coverage with the fewest devices possible

ğŸ“¦ğŸ‘‰ GlassWire: monitor app data usage

ğŸ“¦ğŸ‘‰ TesterKey: generate complex and randomised input values

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Selendroid: test automation framework which drives of the UI of Android native and hybrid applications apps

Web Testing

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ UTF-8 plain text test file

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ Headless Browser list: a list of (almost) all headless web browsers in existence

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ i18n Validator

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Galen Framework: testing layout and responsive design of web applications

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Serenity/JS: a node.js library designed to make acceptance and regression testing of modern web applications faster

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ capybara: acceptance test framework for web applications

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Twitter Card Validator

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Facebook Debugger

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ JSON Test: JSON Testing Service

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ API tester: test API

Dev Tools

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ PutsReq: record HTTP requests and fake responses

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ JS framework benchmark

ğŸ“–ğŸ‘‰ The Ultimate DevOps Tools Ecosystem

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ regex101

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ rubular

ğŸ“¦ğŸ‘‰ Postman

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Truffle Dog: searches through git repositories for high entropy strings, digging deep into commit history and branches

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ HTTPie: a CLI, cURL-like tool for humans

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Slate: API doc generator

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ git-also: for a file in your git repository, prints other files that are most often committed together

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ mitmproxy

ğŸ“€ğŸ‘‰ Tesseract.js

ğŸ’»ğŸ‘‰ asciinema: record and share terminal sessions

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Online Text Obfuscator

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Web Code Tools: code generator

ğŸŒ:point_right: JSON generator: JSON generator

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ For a Good Strftime: easy date time formatting

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Pingy: the simple frontend build tool

Method

ğŸ‘‰ Cynefin Framework for user story splitting

ğŸ‘‰ Product Strategy Canvas

ğŸ‘‰ The ultimate cheat sheet for critical thinking

ğŸ‘‰ Kano model

Search

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Shodan: search engine for Internet-connected devices

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Twitter Analytics

ğŸŒ:point_right: Pexels: best free stock photos in one place

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ StartupVideos: showcasing The Best Startup Videos

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Landingfolio: landing page design inspiration

Design

ğŸŒğŸ‘‰ Colormind: Colormind is a deep learning AI that knows color theory. It can generate color palettes from scratch, or it can take your input and intelligently fill in the blanks.

item.title: 10 (Unpopular but Good Quality) Android Apps I Recommend
item.description:
I feel the urge to make a list before the end of this year. I donn’t know what to add for a list. So, I’m gonna recommend 10 android apps. I would say they’re not quite popular, because none of my friends has them (at least some friends whose phones I’ve checked). Personally, I really like these apps. They are making my life easier very day.

#10 Barcode Scanner
Source code: GitHub
– I use it mostly for QR code scan. It supports to scan ton of codes, which I never used once…

#9 devRant
– A very clean app with full of unclean dev jokes. They’re funny, they’re mean, they’re real devs.

#8 FreeDCam
Source code: GitHub
– A high customizable camera app, specially destined for photo geek.

#7 Opengur
Source code: GitHub
– A really good alternative app of Imgur. At least, unlike Imgur, Opengur always works when uploading pictures.

#6 neutriNote
– It’s one of the best app for editing Markdonw file. I use it a lot as a note app. Only thing is missing here: a sync feature.

#5 Twidere for Twitter
Source code: GitHub
– Clean look, well designed, no Ads, open source. What else do I need as a Twitter client?

#4 LeafPic Gallery
Source code: GitHub
– Light, beautiful and fully functional photo gallery. It’s like the old-good day of QuickPic Gallery and it still keeps purity.

#3 AdAway
Source code: GitHub
– It’s important for me to get rid of annoying Ads.

#2 Total Commander - file manager
– It offers me the power to fully control every single file on my phone. With its plugins, I can share files and get data from ftp server.

#1 Pie Control
– Awesome control tool to replace navigation buttons. Without virtual navigation buttons, phone screen looks super clean. A phone without Pie Control is just simply not “my phone”.

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: June 2016 - December 2016
item.description:
1/4 How does #QA prevent defects? My opinion is "Not really". Similar to how to prevent sickness?

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

2/4 Right release & #QA processes, like good habits, are necessary but not sufficient. Some unexpected virus can still break immune system.

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

3/4 Instead of preventing deflects, #QA should be able to point out issues as early as possible and figure out the risks as well.

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

4/4 Still not convinced by my opinion? Ok, I got another one in my mind:
- How does #QA prevent defects?
- All men must die!

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

1/2 The definition of #Quality is clear in the dictionary. When it's related to a product in reality, it becomes very ambiguous.

— @KevCui June 18, 2016

2/2 I need rethink about:
- Quality is for whom?
- How good quality is good enough for a release?
- How to measure the #Quality?

— @KevCui June 18, 2016

"Deploying a Broken Application Faster Will Not Make It Any Less Broken" Actually it's a good point ğŸ¤” https://t.co/bjImS2Wuz9

— @KevCui June 23, 2016

If you have the power to make people disappointed. Please use it on me now.
If you don't use it on me, I will be disappointed. Would you?

— @KevCui June 28, 2016

Give you 10 more minutes, you will work more efficient? #WhatAbout
Give you 10L more gasoline, you will drive faster?

— @KevCui July 8, 2016

DAY 12: PROBLEM != PRO BLAME #30daysoftesting pic.twitter.com/49SWRzYb9y

— @KevCui July 12, 2016

To whom & my actions during dev:
A sophisticated dev, question why
A reliable dev, discuss how
A careless dev, reminder what#QAThought

— @KevCui August 3, 2016

Q: Who's ur exploratory testing idol?
A: Christopher Columbus
Q: Cause he found America?
A: No I like to punish local ppl as he did #BadJoke

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

If I blame ppl for their mistakes, I would keep blaming myself endlessly...

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

M: Inside every man there is a little boy.
F: How about women?
M: I don't really understand them, do you?
F: ... #BadJoke

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

Trustworthiness
Enthusiasm
Seeking
Thoughtfulness
Efficiency
Rationality #MakeATester

— @KevCui August 10, 2016

As a tester, I should provide as much information as I can and point out as many risks as I can, so that a correct decision can be made.

— @KevCui August 15, 2016

Diff time & results of testing:
0 min nothing works
30 min several bugs
...
2 hours Why can't find even 1 small broken thing?!#QAThought

— @KevCui August 22, 2016

So many X Diven [development|testing]: DDD, BDD, TDD, DDT, CDT...
I've one more DPDT: Developer's Personality Driven Testing ğŸ˜‰ #QAThought

— @KevCui August 22, 2016

Knowing context of question can reflect the answer, which is mostly acceptable by questioner. It's a compromised agreement, not a truth.

— @KevCui August 26, 2016

A trust without proof or evidence is a risk.

— @KevCui August 26, 2016

When I'm hungry, I'm angry.
When I'm full, I'm fool.

— @KevCui August 26, 2016

Finding problems is my top skill, not solving problems. If I cannot see the problem and have to solve the problem. I'll be in the trouble. ğŸ˜±

— @KevCui August 29, 2016

How to prevent XXX? IMO, I've to occur XXX once. I would learn from it to make sure it won't happen again. No one can prevent unknown XXX.

— @KevCui August 29, 2016

Test coverage is a blanket to product as ur body. If it covers body wrongly, doesn't matter its size, you would still get cold. #QAThought

— @KevCui August 29, 2016

You've little thing with u every day. It doesn't change u. But once it disappears, u'll feel uncomfortable. I forgot to wear my smartwatch.

— @KevCui August 29, 2016

If I use my mechanical keyboard to cut the trees, it doesn't work out, would I say this keyboard sucks? Same for tools and frameworks.

— @KevCui August 30, 2016

Testing: find out unexpected anomaly, which will occur in an unknown way
Checking: verify expected result, which was demanded in a req.

— @KevCui August 31, 2016

- Beautiful
- Cheap
- Available now
In general you can max. pick 2 among them.

— @KevCui August 31, 2016

When you received an email from your registered web, telling you to update your password, 50% chance phishing, 50% chance data breach.

— @KevCui September 1, 2016

Talk about editor war between vim and emacs, I remember a saying which is interesting:
Vim is an editor of Gods
Emacs is God of editors

— @KevCui September 5, 2016

Your dream comes true with new Apple watch and new iPhone. Yes! you can dive into the deep sea, catch a... Magikarp #AppleEvent

— @KevCui September 7, 2016

RT â€œItâ€™s easier to fool people than to convince them that theyâ€™ve been fooled.â€

— @KevCui September 15, 2016

A skilled acrobat can perform very dangerous moves without safety net. Why needs a safety net?
For acrobat...
For circus...
For audience...

— @KevCui October 4, 2016

Whole team tests+Full TDD+More SDET+Less tester+No QA+dogfooding+crowd/openbeta testing~=secured testing shift planhttps://t.co/4LB5W36nJ6

— @KevCui October 11, 2016

IMO, to a startup, the critical risks usually come from outside.
To a corporation, the critical risks usually come from inside.

— @KevCui October 13, 2016

1/3 Different company type influences its working env, process, culture. Culture effects the way of thinking, eventually effects mindset.

— @KevCui October 13, 2016

2/3 To apply certain mindset regardless company type as a context, is like putting a fish on the tree, to see how it will climb well.

— @KevCui October 13, 2016

3/3 To understand which kind of company is important to predict its culture in general, avoiding a culture shock.

— @KevCui October 13, 2016

When laptop is on & you still want to clean keyboard, before that just open a full screen and run vi. 99% sure no mistake will happen...

— @KevCui October 21, 2016

Misunderstand data + No knowledge inside blackbox = Wrong conclusion #KevFail
ER: Hand accurate info to right person, guess stays as guess

— @KevCui October 26, 2016

Given once a while
When I have to eat a ğŸ’©
Then I'll do it in an elegant way with a good mood
But I'd know after if ğŸ’© is really unavoidable

— @KevCui October 28, 2016

"I've 10 years experience. It must be done this way." Without a convincible reason, I'll say "I don't want to eat 10 years ğŸ’© as you did."

— @KevCui November 3, 2016

My role: Quality Control -> Quality Assurance -> Quality Assistance
Me: Focus product -> Focus process -> Focus team motivation on testing

— @KevCui November 4, 2016

1/2 Testing should be full of fun, like a treasure hunting, an Easter egg search, a Geocache... a game to enjoy to have fun, not to win it

— @KevCui November 4, 2016

2/2 I'd like to make a Team Testing:
New features over Whole product
User nature act over Planned step
Motivation driven over Result driven

— @KevCui November 4, 2016

If I say awesome, means I agree
If I say OK, means I don't care
If I care but don't agree, I go crazy
Yep I know it's me Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯ I'm OK.

— @KevCui November 4, 2016

Make amen great again...

— @KevCui November 9, 2016

You don't just hide things. You hide your secrets. ğŸ‘€

— @KevCui November 15, 2016

Agility:
Know context
Make small steps
Choose changeable way
Create own best practice
"Agile is Dead https://t.co/gnGGovqm5z" via @pragdave

— @KevCui November 15, 2016

Think carefully, do crazy. #MyMotto

— @KevCui November 17, 2016

Heard a middle-aged lady says "Car Zwei Go". My reaction was... pic.twitter.com/rLj9ORUYRG

— @KevCui November 21, 2016

What I learnt:
1. Never ignore an OS if it's still in scope
2. Still perform some tests on low coverage OS to at least check main functions

— @KevCui November 28, 2016

How about I take a box of salad on one shelf and change it with a sandwich on another self? Then I pass a banana to an old lady... #AmazonGo

— @KevCui December 5, 2016

Great talk!
- Don't do Agile, be agile
- Outcomes over outputs
- Focus on real customers and resolve their real problems https://t.co/fPpIFGImUX

— @KevCui December 10, 2016
